security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing no executable code. Only reads/writes markdown text files. No network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities beyond standard text operations.

content.value_statement: AI responses often miss the mark due to vague or incomplete prompts. This skill provides structured frameworks, proven techniques, and templates for crafting clear, specific prompts that get the results you want.
actual_capabilities: Provide structured prompt frameworks (Role, Context, Task, Format)
Explain prompting techniques (Zero-Shot, Few-Shot, Chain-of-Thought, Role Prompting)
Offer anti-patterns to avoid when writing prompts
limitations: Does not execute code or interact with external APIs
Cannot access files or system resources
Provides guidance only, no automated prompt generation
Does not integrate with specific platform features

use_cases.title: Write Effective Code Prompts
use_cases.description: Structure technical requests with environment details, constraints, and clear goals for accurate code generation.

use_cases.title: Create Consistent AI Content

prompt_templates.title: Basic Structure
prompt_templates.prompt:
## Role
[Define AI role]

## Context
[Background and constraints]

## Task
[Specific request]

## Format
[Desired output format]

prompt_templates.title: Code Request
prompt_templates.prompt:
## Environment
- Language: [language]
- Framework: [framework]
- Version: [version]

## Current State
[Current code]

## Goal
[Desired outcome]

## Constraints
- [Constraint 1]
- [Constraint 2]

prompt_templates.title: Chain-of-Thought
prompt_templates.prompt:
Think through this step by step:
1. First, analyze the problem...
2. List possible solutions...
3. Evaluate each option...
4. Select the best solution...

prompt_templates.title: System Prompt
prompt_templates.prompt:
# Identity
[AI purpose and role]

# Capabilities
- [Capability 1]
- [Capability 2]

# Constraints
- [Limit 1]
- [Limit 2]

# Response Format
[Formatting rules]

output_examples.input: Help me write a function to sort a list of users by their registration date.
output: A clear prompt would specify: language (Python), data structure (User objects with registration_date field), sort order (newest first), and output format (return code with comments).
The AI will generate more accurate code when constraints like error handling and edge cases (empty list, duplicate dates) are explicitly mentioned.

best_practices: Be specific about environment, constraints, and expected output format.
Use the Role-Context-Task-Format structure for complex requests.
Provide examples when seeking a particular style or format.
Iterate by evaluating results and adding missing constraints.
anti_patterns: Vague requests like 'fix my code' without specifying the error or goal.
Overloading prompts with irrelevant information that obscures the core request.
Negative instructions ('do not use X') instead of positive guidance ('use Y').
Open-ended requests without scope boundaries or success criteria.

faq.question: Which AI tools support these prompting techniques?
faq.answer: These techniques work with all major AI assistants including Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini, and Codex. Each platform responds to structured prompts similarly.

faq.question: How long can my prompts be?
faq.answer: Most platforms support prompts up to several thousand tokens. Complex requests benefit from detail, but stay focused on relevant information.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple techniques?
faq.answer: Yes. Combining techniques like role prompting with chain-of-thought often produces better results than single approaches.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these prompts?
faq.answer: This skill contains only guidance text. No data is sent anywhere. Your prompts remain private to the AI service you use.

faq.question: Why does my prompt sometimes fail?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing context, conflicting constraints, or unclear success criteria. Use the framework structure to ensure completeness.

faq.question: How is this different from system prompts?
faq.answer: System prompts set permanent AI behavior. User prompts are single requests. This skill covers both: system design and user-facing techniques.
